doc.title: Milan's Silvio Berlusconi calls for footballers' salary cap
doc.author: Guardian Staff; Guardian staff reporter
doc.description: The Milan owner Silvio Berlusconi believes the huge wages being paid to players are unacceptable in the current economic climate

main.p: The Milan owner and Italian prime minster Silvio Berlusconi has described the massive wages being paid to footballers as unacceptable in the current economic climate and called for a salary cap.
"Footballers' salaries are outside reality. It is necessary to introduce a salary cap," Berlusconi was reported as saying by the ANSA news agency today.
"They are unacceptable, distant from the real economy in which we live in a difficult time like this. They are outside every parameter."
Berlusconi also denied speculation he intended to sell part of his stake in the Serie A club.
